page.title: 20ROADS AND TRANSPORT, BURTON
page.content: Over the years there have been large changes in the roads of the Burton area. Once, the road from Haverfordwest ended at Burton Ferry and there were small ferry boats to Pembroke and Neyland. Then in 1972 a bridge was built across Westfield Pill and the road was extended from Burton Ferry to Neyland. On the opening of the bridge over the River Cleddau in 1975 the road system was extended to Pembroke and Pembroke Dock. There is one bus service in our area and the first bus goes from Pembroke to Haverfordwest at 8.00a.m., this also takes children to their Secondary School in the town.At present there are two more return services during the day. The last, also taking children home from school, arriving in Pembroke at 4.40 p.m..
